title: what is with all the main yasuo in low ello?
body: 80% in my games in ranked i get a mid main yasuo who is last pick or one of the last picks and they want to play it...no matter we tell them not to...they want to play yasuo on any lane...and if ubann it they troll...What should we do with this main yasuo players who dont understand team game just want to solo play yasuo everywhere? Do anybody else have a problem with them?

replies.body:
The best way to tackle your problem is to play something with a knock up and actually help him out.
It's easy to win games by knocking up their team and yasuo R Q W's to delete 2-3 players, the only issue is people forget is weak early game power.

Play a knock up champ thats strong early game; Alistar (Tanks are amazing in low elo)

read my comment.

Yasuo is a high-skill-ceiling champion.

Bad players often think that playing high-skill-ceiling champions will either make them skilled or make other people think they are skilled.

What they do not know is that a lot of those popular champs like {{champion:55}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:92}} are actually zero-skill-floor and require nothing more complex than facerolling your keyboard. Their high-skill reputation relates to lots of advanced, difficult tricks that tend to be unneeded for facerolling in bronze.

All four of them have incredible mobility/juke potential, riven has animation canceling tricks, kat has reset shenanigans; but all you usually see is clickclickclickclickQWERRRRRRRRRRRRF6

Compare to champions with high skill/experience ceiling _and_ floor, like {{champion:268}} {{champion:136}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:76}} .. You do not see them very often and their low elo winrates are mostly hilariously bad.

What gets me about these so called mains is that they always lose hard when yasuo gets picked in the other team.

I don't know about anyone else but I know the strengths and weaknesses of my two mains, i know how to play against then

{{champion:84}} and {{champion:61}} are very hard to deal with as yasuo, especially {{champion:61}} why? Because you have to keep where her ball is in mind when weaving between the minions. if you don't stop moving as yasuo mid than she'll most likely kill you. and also if you dive her she'll shield herself. {{champion:84}} Needs to be shut down before level 6. if you don't get her in the window and she rushes {{item:3146}}, than you're as good as dead. {{champion:238}} shits on yasuo if yasuo doesn't keep dashing when he ults.
Why are u trying to tell others what they should or shouldnt pick?

yes and its been like that since release of yasuo, people tend to like flashy plays and high skill cap champs but end up bringing neither of those qualities with their gameplay. I always see yasuos dashing to enemy minions for fun in lane just because it looks cool then they get ganked and have nothing to use because they were being reckless. Or they expect you to play a knockup champ to cater around them and then they end up feeding in lane, just because Nami uses her ult to peel doesnt mean go in with yasuo 1v5 lol!!!!!!!
